problems.title: N-Queens
problems.description:
Problem Statement

The n-queens puzzle is the problem of placing n queens on an n x n chessboard such that no two queens attack each other.

Given an integer n, return all distinct solutions to the n-queens puzzle.

Each solution contains a distinct board configuration of the n-queens' placement, where 'Q' and '.' indicate a queen and an empty space, respectively.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4

Sample Output
.Q.. ...Q Q... ..Q.
..Q. Q... ...Q .Q..

Explanation:
Two distinct solutions for 4-queens.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def solveNQueens(self, n):
        # TODO: Return list of boards (each board is list of strings)
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    n = int(input())
    sol = Solution()
    result = sol.solveNQueens(n)
    # Format: Flatten each board to a single line, join boards with space
    output = []
    for board in result:
        output.append(' '.join(board))
    output.sort()
    print(' '.join(output))

hintsList: Use arrays to track columns, diagonals, and anti-diagonals.
